author: tekwreck
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Created PS-Credentials, create new-pssession
## Expected behavior

Suppose to initiated a new PS Session
## Actual behavior

Program Crashes
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: I believe that this is currently as expected as detailed in the KNOWNISSUES.md file at https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md (though finding that file could be easier)

comments.author: BrendanThompson
comments.body:
It seems as though there will be a module released to allow for **PowerShell Remoting** to work:

> # Remoting Support
> 
> Client-side remoting from Linux is not supported with the initial package. This will be enabled shortly after the Alpha release by installing an additional package.

As listed in the [KNOWNISSUES.md](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md) document. Is there any timeframe around when that module will be released?

comments.author: bviktor
comments.body: Ouch. ATM PowerShell remoting is also broken on Windows since the last update, so we're dead in the water lol.

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: @bviktor @jaredneedell - Coming back to this have you run the Install-PowerShellRemoting.ps1 script in the C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.9\ (assuming this is on Windows) as I've managed to get PSSessions from 6.0.0.9 to another machine which doesnt have 6.0.0.9 installed

comments.author: bviktor
comments.body: @kilasuit dunno, in fact I've migrated my Windows comp to Linux for some testing so can't check it ATM. TIll then, fingers crossed for Linux PS Remoting :)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Per the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md#remoting-support), this is **not yet supported**.  Please follow the progress on the [PSRP on Linux repo](https://github.com/PowerShell/psl-omi-provider). Closing as duplicate of #942.

title: New-PSSession Unhandled Exception Ubuntu 16
